data.title: Theme fixes from light
Debug option "Visible Navigation" doesn't work in tilemaps
data.body:
Windows 10, official stable download (2.1.4)


If "visible navigation" is on but navpolys are in a tilemap they aren't visualized at runtime.

data.title: Fixed delete animation frames in AnimatedSprite, issue 10788
data.body:
Fixed not being able to delete animation frames in AnimatedSprite.

Surprised no one spotted this before as it was never implemented.

closes #10788

data.title: Added support for brace auto indent and fixed indent above.
data.body:
Added support for auto indent with braces, if followed by a closing brace it will place it on the next line. 
Also fixes auto indenting when `ctrl+shift` is used to insert above the current line.

data.title: [2.1.4] 2D shader parser bug?
data.body:
Windows 10 x64 - tested in Godot v2.1.3 and v2.1.4 x64 - GeForce 560Ti - 384.94

I happened to write a shader that sometimes works fine and sometimes fails to compile. Included in example project. If compilation fails, the screen goes completely white.
`ERROR: ShaderGLES2::get_current_version: CanvasShaderGLES2: Fragment Program Compilation Failed:
0(276) : error C1008: undefined variable "_lightmult"
At: drivers\gles2\shader_gles2.cpp:471`
   
Error message from 2.1.3. It was working fine before I added a couple of additional parameters. There is a uniform variable called "lightmult" in the shader, without an underscore...

To reproduce, open the example project. If shader compiled correctly, close the editor and open it and the project again.

[shader_compilation_bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1272243/shader_compilation_bug.zip)

data.title: Improve 'quick open' search time
data.body:
As far as I understand quick open was sorting item list as many times as many folders there is in the project. As @vnen suggested I moved sorting code, to be performed after the file fetching. Also right before sorting, there are computed similarity scores for each item, and cached locally which additionally slightly (but noticeably) improves performance.
closes #9864

data.title: [2.1] Some improvements for debugger
data.body:
- [x] Fix continous update of the remote properties
- [x] Remove useless debugger property panel
- [x] Rename Remote Inspector to Live Scene Tree
- [x] Editor crashes when edit remote object instances from inspector edit history after debugging finshed.
- [x] Fix the continous update of the remote properties push tons of objects into edit history.
~~Improve data serialization/desrialization with the debug remote and client.~~

data.title: Add contact_monitor checking when rigidbody2d enters and exits the tree
data.body:
Sometimes I get Segmentation Fault error after freeing of rigidbody2d in case, when I used contact_monitor feature.
As I found, there are no checking is it NULL or not when rigidbody2d enters and exits the tree.

I have just added `if(contact_monitor)`

mentioned in #10489 closes #10881

data.title: DocData / MethodInfo issues
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Any OS, master branch (4d580d76)

**Issue description:**
There are several issues left with the new DocData / MethodInfo which are visible in the diff of my recent doctool sync, 4d580d76.
Complete diff (850 KB): [godot-classref-diff.txt](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1272066/godot-classref-diff.txt)

- [x] `DEFVAL` arguments are still incorrectly registered, see e.g.:
```diff
                <method name="draw_polygon">
+                       <return type="void">
+                       </return>
                        <argument index="0" name="points" type="PoolVector2Array">
                        </argument>
                        <argument index="1" name="colors" type="PoolColorArray">
                        </argument>
-                       <argument index="2" name="uvs" type="PoolVector2Array" default="PoolVector2Array([])">
+                       <argument index="2" name="uvs" type="PoolVector2Array" default="null">
+                       </argument>
+                       <argument index="3" name="texture" type="Texture" default="PoolVector2Array(  )">
                        </argument>
-                       <argument index="3" name="texture" type="Texture" default="NULL">
+                       <argument index="4" name="normal_map" type="Texture" default="null">
                        </argument>
-                       <argument index="4" name="normal_map" type="Texture" default="NULL">
+                       <argument index="5" name="antialiased" type="bool" default="null">
                        </argument>
                        <description>
-                               Draw a polygon of any amount of points, convex or concave.
                        </description>
                </method>
```

- [x] Related, many default arguments for `String`, `int` or `bool` end up as `null` instead of `""`, `true`/`false` or a number:
```diff
-                       <argument index="3" name="body" type="String" default="""">
+                       <argument index="3" name="body" type="String" default="null">
[...]
-                       <argument index="3" name="flags" type="int" default="7">
+                       <argument index="3" name="flags" type="int" default="null">
```

- [x] `Error` enum as return type is not properly inferred (or any enum as return type maybe?):
```diff
@@ -13483,7 +15289,7 @@
                        </description>
                </method>
                <method name="make_dir_recursive">
-                       <return type="Error">
+                       <return type="int">
                        </return>
                        <argument index="0" name="path" type="String">
                        </argument>
```

- [ ] Some `Object` types seem incorrectly inferred:
```diff
@@ -28286,10 +31436,11 @@
                        </description>
                </method>
                <method name="set_script">
-                       <argument index="0" name="script" type="Script">
+                       <return type="void">
+                       </return>
+                       <argument index="0" name="script" type="Reference">
                        </argument>
                        <description>
-                               Set a script into the object, scripts extend the object functionality.
                        </description>
                </method>
                <method name="tr" qualifiers="const">

[...]

                <method name="set_stream_peer">
-                       <argument index="0" name="peer" type="StreamPeer">
+                       <return type="void">
+                       </return>
+                       <argument index="0" name="peer" type="Reference">
                        </argument>
                        <description>
-                               Set the StreamPeer object to be wrapped
                        </description>
                </method>

[...]

                <method name="set_shape">
-                       <argument index="0" name="shape" type="Shape2D">
+                       <return type="void">
+                       </return>
+                       <argument index="0" name="shape" type="Resource">
                        </argument>
                        <description>
-                               Set the [Shape2D] that will be used for collision/intersection queries.
                        </description>
                </method>

[...]

                <method name="add_collision_exception_with">
-                       <argument index="0" name="body" type="PhysicsBody">
+                       <return type="void">
+                       </return>
+                       <argument index="0" name="body" type="Node">
                        </argument>
                        <description>
                        </description>
@@ -32170,18 +35687,24 @@
                        </description>
                </method>
                <method name="remove_collision_exception_with">
-                       <argument index="0" name="body" type="PhysicsBody">
+                       <return type="void">
+                       </return>
+                       <argument index="0" name="body" type="Node">
                        </argument>
                        <description>
                        </description>
                </method>

[...]

                <method name="create_item">
-                       <return type="TreeItem">
+                       <return type="Object">
                        </return>
-                       <argument index="0" name="parent" type="TreeItem" default="NULL">
+                       <argument index="0" name="parent" type="Object" default="null">
                        </argument>
                        <description>
-                               Create an item in the tree and add it as the last child of [code]parent[/code]. If parent is not given, it will be added as the last child of the root, or it
'll the be the root itself if the tree is empty.
                        </description>
                </method>
```

CC @reduz @neikeq

data.title: Scroll bar jitters when scrolling up in the script editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Win7,  [Godot-Windows-x86_64-2017-08-31.f9eec5c](https://bintray.com/calinou/godot/editor/2017-08-31.f9eec5c#files). Doesn't occur on the official godot 3 alpha 1 build.

**Issue description:**

[Video](https://streamable.com/jf7ha) 

When scrolling up in the script editor, the scroll bar will flicker up and down. This only happens when scrolling up. Scrolling down is completely smooth. 

I don't have this issue anywhere else so I don't think it's a problem with my mouse.

data.title: Texture Importing issue
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
windows, nvidia, f9eec5c 

**Issue description:**
godot imports textures very slowly. when you put like 4 textures in the folder and go back to the editor, it will import them like 5 minutes (other tools and editors on my PC do it much quicker)

and when i tried using 8x4k texture it imported it (very slowly) fine. it even generated a thumbnail for it. but when i assigned it to a shader, editor started reimport (for 3d i assume) and crashed.

this is not caused by the shader, because it may be just a single uniform declaration and nothing else.
it is caused by reimport for 3d

UPD: as soon as i select the texture, it appears on the mesh (when using standard shader for example) but after this, editor starts reimport and crashes. seems strange now, after i've noticed that texture is applyed to the mesh first.

UPD2: tried to reimport the texture with '3D' preset manually. editor just does not respond forever after displaying '(Re)Importing' dialog.

UPD3: downscaled texture in image editor to 4x2k and it works, but reimporting on assigning to shader takes much more then initial import.

data.title: camera smoothing choppy when following player
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
windows 10, Godot 2.1.4, Intel(R) Celeron(R) N2940, 

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Camera is child of player and smoothing is on, when moving player the movement seams choppy or jittery, swing back an forth while moving in intended direction.


**Steps to reproduce:**
move player while camera is attached as child and enable smoothing (tested with speed on 5)


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
example project
https://filebin.ca/3Yy9thBGbvVc/camrea_follow_test-bugversion.tscn

example workaround using lerp:
https://filebin.ca/3Yy0y8IejjmJ/camrea_follow_test.tscn

data.title: Emoji support
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows, Godot 2.1.4

**Issue description:**
Godot does not render many emojis.  I attempted to use a RichTextLabel containing the text:

`te😊x🌐t🔼ᴥ♻🚀❂☮☯🚀🎡🚢🍭💦🔻`

And instead what renders is:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13324089/29986552-e950dbea-8f31-11e7-9578-4da28913e3ba.png)

I did this using a dynamic font for the node and I tried loading EmojiOneColor-SVGinOT.ttf, OpenSansEmoji.ttf, and unifont-10.0.06.ttf all with very limited success.  The EmojiOneColor comes with a demo which, when opened in Chrome, renders just fine in B&W including many of the symbols I'm looking to use.  Finding an adequate demo of the other fonts is a bit more difficult than I imagined.

data.title: Fix AnimationTreePlayer::animation_node_set_filter_path prototype
data.body: This prototype was accidentally changed and godot would not compile.

data.title: [Discussion] Output area improvements
data.body:
I think there are some ways the output could be improved. I'm interested in what you think and if you have other suggestions.

1. At the moment the output area just displays text. But you can't really tell where the `print()`-call came from. In unity for example it shows the file name and the line number. And you can also double click the text to jump directly to the `print()`-call (as described here #10566 ).
2. The next thing in unity is, that there are different versions of logs. You can use `Debug.Log()`, `Debug.LogWarning()` and `Debug.LogError()`. These logs show up with different icons leading the text and the text is a different color. You can also selectively toggle which types of logs should be displayed. Even though this is quite nice to have 3 different options to select from, I think it would be quite interesting to go one step further. Maybe let us create our own tags to use. You could select an icon for these tags and set a specific color. And some kind of filtering mechanism would also be helpful.
3. In unity you can use rich text markup to add different styles to the string. I'm not sure if this is necessary, but it just crossed my mind when thinking about improving the output.
4. Another feature from unity is that you can use a game-object as a second parameter, like so `public static void Log(object message, Object context);`. When clicking only once on the output-log it highlights this object in the scene-hierarchy. In godot it could bring up the remote-inspector and show the context-object selected in the live scene tree.

I know I mentioned a lot of unity-like behavior, but I think many developers could benefit from some of these features. So what are your thoughts?
